Text:
Child poverty rates have been cut in 1/2 but continue to remain high.

For #BlackHistoryMonth @TheBlackCaucus & @JECDems released a report examining progress made & work still needed to address the socioeconomic barriers Black Americans face.
#JECxCBC

https://t.co/ygTmBRAsro https://t.co/fbgmQQdjQU

Today we joined @FieldandForkWNY & @feedmorewny at @OLVHServices to announce a $3M grant addressing food insecurity in WNY.

The grant supports the Double Up Food Bucks program, which matches SNAP benefits dollar for dollar at farmers markets, mobile markets, & grocery stores. https://t.co/GYqteZexsI

All students deserve safe & well-funded public schools. The #AmericanRescuePlan invested $391M in Erie/Niagara schools to address challenges students & teachers are facing amid COVID-19.

This #PublicSchoolsWeek let's recommit to investing in an equitable future for our students.

Vaccines are still our best defense against COVID-19. @ECDOH is offering several vaccination clinics for the remainder of the month.

Check out the February vaccination calendar today to schedule an appointment: https://t.co/MSDGUAnjfg

The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw is making long overdue investments & upgrades toward our roads & bridges.

During #EngineersWeek we are recognizing the professionals working to ensure the safety of our local transportation infrastructure.

Thanks to the #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw we are investing in the future of our community by providing families with affordable broadband access.

Over 10M households have already signed up for the Affordable Connectivity Program. See if you're eligible: https://t.co/TQFihwyWB2 https://t.co/HH2XOX6kWL

Today on #PresidentsDay we honor our past & present leaders that have worked to preserve our democratic values & freedoms.

Thank you @POTUS for your continued leadership & vision for change. We are grateful for the progress made toward rebuilding our economy & infrastructure. https://t.co/G2mhR6gfFI

Great to be back on the @buffalostate campus again today with journalism students Michael & Elijah who are working on a story in conjunction with @bflobroadcaster that will cover Buffalo's Renaissance. We look forward to tuning in when it airs! https://t.co/NlVRDY8EyT

Caregiving is essential. Many are paid, and many just volunteer time and effort for loved ones. On #NationalCaregiversDay we recognize how important this work is and are reminded how Congress must do more to acknowledge it. https://t.co/5gmGd3ac1I

Today we joined @EPAregion2 @NYSDEC @BNWaterkeeper & @citizensenviro to detail how $1B in #GreatLakes funding in the #Infrastructure Law will have a lasting impact on WNY. This 5-yr investment will delist the Buffalo River, Niagara River & Eighteen Mile Creek as Areas of Concern. https://t.co/H6skBZY1Ee

REMINDER: Local Fire Departments

Fire Prevention & Safety grant applications are due today at 5PM. FP&S grants provide critical funding to improve public & firefighter safety during emergencies.

Learn more & submit your application: https://t.co/bic5nEG9oI

#TBT - 100+ years ago WNY African American musicians created Local 533 of @The_AFM, the Colored Musicians Club.

The club educates visitors on its history & its notable performers like Billie Holiday, Duke Ellington, & Ella Fitzgerald. #BlackHistoryMonth
https://t.co/d42MHvP5jQ
Sending a huge congratulations to Getzville native & Olympic Silver Medalist @HScamurra! WNY is proud of you & all the women representing @usahockey at the 2022 Winter Olympics. #TeamUSA

This is huge news for #GreatLakes communities, including WNY, made possible thanks to the Bipartisan #Infrastructure Law.

Cleanup of the Buffalo River, Niagara River & Eighteen Mile Creek will provide lasting environmental & economic returns in Erie & Niagara Counties.

Watch ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/KHH4Ut9cj2

Veterans & the WNY community have wanted and waited for the opening of this cemetery providing a fitting final resting place for those who served. We need to do everything to ensure veterans and grieving family members can visit the site safely. https://t.co/XNH5AnCPXY
Do you have questions or need assistance with Medicare benefits? Our office is here to help! Give us a call at 716-852-3501. https://t.co/zofczzqtY5

The City of Tonawanda is handing out free COVID-19 test kits & masks to residents on FRIDAY at:

Tonawanda City Hall: 8:30AM-4:30PM
Tonawanda Senior Center: 9AM-5PM
Tonawanda Fire HQ: 24 hours
Tonawanda Police HQ: 5PM-7AM https://t.co/9dhR2B9xIw

Quality childcare & pre-K give kids an important educational start, setting them up for future success. For many families the costs are unaffordable.

We must continue fighting for affordable childcare & universal pre-K through Head Start programs, schools, & licensed providers.

Expanded by the #AmericanRescuePlan in 2021, the #EarnedIncomeTaxCredit is helping to lift workers of all ages out of poverty by boosting the full credit & allowing workers 19-24 & 65+ without children to claim it. https://t.co/znuTzuBO5J

The Affordable Connectivity Program, included in the #Infrastructure law, provides families with affordable internet. 10M eligible households have already signed up!

Get a $30/month discount on your internet bill & $100 off a tablet/computer.

Details: https://t.co/TQFihwyWB2

ATTN: Local Fire Depts & Non-profit Orgs

FP&S Grant applications are due THIS WEEK on Feb. 18 before 5pm. Don't miss out on federal funding for education & training efforts that work to keep our community safe!

More info: https://t.co/OauVdrrTPA https://t.co/l7pNBIJPeQ
This #ValentinesDay, show support for local businesses across Western New York! #ShopSmall & #DineSmall with your loved ones today. https://t.co/dhK38oKiXy

Four years ago 17 innocent lives were lost to gun violence during the #Parkland shooting. Today this same violence is still occurring at home & across the US.

Let's recommit to fighting for common sense gun reform that reduces community violence & prevents tragedies like this.

We joined @wnypeace at the Love for Afghanistan Vigil in Buffalo. Proud to live in a community welcoming to refugees. After ending a 20 yr war we are glad to bring our troops home & nation build thru efforts ranging from universal pre-k to affordable Rx drugs. #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/oxGfY9fHgu

Today marks the 13th anniversary of the flight 3407 crash in Clarence, New York.

Flight @3407families turned their pain into purpose, leading an effort to pass the Airline Safety & FAA Act of 2010. We have this group of advocates to thank for safer skies today & into the future. https://t.co/scX0yKs4za

Resources for free at-home COVID-19 tests are coming soon for Medicare beneficiaries! Medicare will now cover 8 free tests each month from pharmacies & healthcare providers.

Read more: https://t.co/4J6ktNCFNN

#FBF - The Nash House was home to Rev. J. Edward Nash, Sr., Pastor of the Michigan Ave Baptist Church.
He opened the church's doors to abolitionists & those on the Underground Railroad. We visited the house to learn about his legacy. #BlackHistoryMonth 
https://t.co/bRzDr6AQRP

Today on International Day of Women & Girls in Science we recognize the achievements of #WomenInScience & the need to support future trailblazers.

In particular we celebrate Anita Dorr, an @ECMCBuffalo ER nurse who invented the crash cart. https://t.co/lgpFXNqeOX
211 is such a valuable resource for WNYers and has been a helpful place for people to turn throughout the pandemic. Thank you @211WNY! #211Day https://t.co/XDBR1QI9KG

Electric vehicles are a critical pathway to a clean energy future in WNY. Electric cars & buses reduce pollution while meeting our mobility needs.

Thanks to the #Infrastructure Law, NYS is receiving over $25M for electric vehicle charging infrastructure. #ElectrifyingAmerica https://t.co/zTu4IpVi09

In 2021, Community Development Block Grants funded 13 projects thru the @ErieCountyNY Consortium.

$1.34M in fed funds helped improve infrastructure, small biz districts & accessibility.

Today we visited Grand Island Town hall, where CDBG funding helped install a new elevator. https://t.co/bfZMkSUIiw
The GI Bill helps veterans pay for college, graduate school, & training programs. Are you a veteran looking to start an education program? Check out these resources ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/ibaHH8IsJW

This is every parent's worst nightmare.

As a @Buffalo_Schools grad this hits close to home, but we know way too many schools & families across the US have faced similar terrible days.

While details are still coming in, our hearts are with the @MackHighSchool community.

Indiana Hunt-Martin was a WWII vet serving in the 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion, the only Black WAC unit overseas.

Our bill renaming Buffalo's Central Park Post Office in her honor advanced thru @OversightDems Cmte!

Next step: A House VOTE!
https://t.co/GtDt9PXqYH

Across the world there is an alarming rise in violence against the LGBTQI+ community.

The #GlobalRespectAct holds individuals abroad accountable for these human right abuses, denying visas into the US. Hate has no place in our country & we're proud to support this bill. https://t.co/IukXHl7ayy

Reminder: You can order up to 4 free at-home COVID-19 tests delivered right to your mailbox.

Order today at: https://t.co/ia88vZtVbB

It's always great to see WNYers in DC.
Caught up with @NiagaraUniv's Tom Burns at the National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities event in Washington yesterday.
#PurpleEagles https://t.co/5IWgbTO8v4

APPROVED: #PostalServiceReformAct
üíå Protects @USPS Jobs
üì´ Preserves trusted mail delivery for Americans

More information:
https://t.co/Jy3RiT9vaz https://t.co/nJ4SeV6pHR

Social media plays a major role in our lives, particularly for kids & young adults. On #SaferInternetDay we're calling on social media companies to remove harmful content damaging children's mental health. Suicide rates are rising among youth & this will save lives. #TakeThemDown https://t.co/9p1wNXaeKt

The @USPS employs 630K Americans, delivering mail to millions of homes each year.

The #PostalServiceReformAct provides critical financial support, preserves mail delivery 6 days per week, & ensures that retirees have access to quality healthcare through Medicare. https://t.co/TNk6UyE45d

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests in our future by:
üë©‚Äçüî¨ Funding research & innovation in new technology
üè≠ Investing in American manufacturing
üöõ Improving our supply chains
üåø Building a cleaner economy

In WNY this means good-paying jobs & opportunities for education & training.

.@DocCandace discusses how @Roswellpark is poised to lead on the #CancerMoonshot

"WNY is home to many such bold thinkers & our community can count on us to do our part to meet the @POTUS's challenge to 'fundamentally change cancer as we know it'"

READ: https://t.co/gPwdmgALwa

DYK  - Shirley Chisholm, the first Black women elected to Congress, has ties to Western New York?

Her husband Arthur Hardwick was an Erie County resident & both served in the NYS Assembly.
They were laid to rest in @ForestLawnCem.
#BlackHistoryMonth
#learnlivemakeblackhistory https://t.co/IOcKwoimwl

60M Americans have signed away their rights at work through forced arbitration clauses & many aren't aware of it.

Today the House is voting on historic, pro-labor legislation to #EndForcedArbitration, protecting & giving a voice to survivors of sexual harassment & assault. https://t.co/FLoVcYNhPI

Today marks National Black HIV & Aids Awareness Day.

HIV & AIDS disproportionately impacts the Black community. We must continue working to end associated stigmas & provide the resources necessary for equal access to treatment & prevention. #NBHAAD

The Bipartisan #Infrastructure Law invests billions towards improving water infrastructure.

We must repeal the #DirtyWaterRule to ensure that our rivers, waterways, & the overall health of the WNY community are protected under the #CleanWaterAct. https://t.co/5c11J2xD2x

ATTN: Local Fire Departments & Non-profit orgs

Fire Prevention & Safety grants work to support education & training efforts to ensure our community is prepared for emergences. Don't miss out! Applications are due Feb 18 before 5pm.

More info: https://t.co/OauVdrrTPA https://t.co/xWSJXWso0N

Many WNY schools are providing kids with free/ reduced breakfast & lunch. This might make you eligible for the Affordable Connectivity Program.

ACP delivers a monthly discount on internet bills & a one-time discount on a tablet or computer.

Learn more: https://t.co/TQFihwyWB2

"Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night..."

It's not an easy job, especially during weeks like this one in Buffalo. Today and every day we thank the USPS workers delivering for America.

#ThankAMailCarrierDay https://t.co/cJrhLhwQ3r

Promoting unionization and protecting worker rights is a top priority of mine in Congress. Congress, itself, should be included in this effort. Proud to support the right of all workers to organize, including Congressional staff.

Heart disease is a leading cause of death in the US, impacting 1 in 3 women.

On #WearRedDay let's continue raising awareness about women's cardiovascular health. Most heart disease & stroke deaths are preventable, but we must provide funding to make treatment more accessible.

ATTN: Local Fire Departments

The application window for SAFER Grants ends TODAY at 5pm. Don't miss out on crucial federal funding to support recruitment, hiring, & retention.

More info: https://t.co/zuJZxenc8I

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act invests in technology of the future, improves supply chains, & strengthens our economy.

In WNY, it will create good-paying, sustainable jobs in manufacturing & STEM, as well as opportunities for education & training. Proud to support this historic bill. https://t.co/uis7c7fw6q

Each year, +1.6M Americans are diagnosed with cancer & approximately 600k will lose their lives.

This #WorldCancerDay, we are pushing to fully fund the #CancerMoonshot w/ investments that support cancer research, prevention, screening & treatment.
https://t.co/J17gLLnhKG https://t.co/gEs8b4UCjH

On her birthday, celebrating the fortitude of Rosa Parks.

‚ÄúStand for something or you will fall for anything. Today‚Äôs mighty oak is yesterday‚Äôs nut that held its ground.‚Äù - Rosa Parks

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/qjc5kj6McP
Tune in now to watch this important discussion on how we can work to better address the health needs of people with disabilities... https://t.co/qyKMJjC2Kq

The pandemic has dramatically impacted longstanding connections between the US & Canada.

Canada's 1% tax on property owned by non-Canadians, including vacation homes, will violate the USMCA & negatively impact both economies. We urge Canada to reject this unfair proposal. https://t.co/nTeknZXC3m

Check out this great piece on the "Six Triple Eight." WNYer Indiana Hunt-Martin was among the women who served in this unit.

Proud to cosponsor legislation that would award the members of this Women's Army Corps battalion the Congressional Gold Medal.  #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/nvnPAaY90t

An investment in childcare is an investment in our community. Quality childcare & pre-K give children the best opportunity for success, but high costs make it challenging for both families & providers.

We will continue fighting for free universal pre-K for all 3 & 4 year olds. https://t.co/FAWUxIkLX7

Today from the @WhiteHouse we joined the @POTUS, @FLOTUS & @VP in relaunching the #CancerMoonshot initiative to end cancer as we know it today.

This national imperative will be led by @theNCI cancer centers including @RoswellPark right here in WNY. https://t.co/rg5cfWKUS2

It should be America's mission to end suffering due to cancer in our lifetime. @POTUS's supercharged #CancerMoonshot initiative will help focus our continued efforts to achieve that goal. Proud to join this announcement today. https://t.co/AZoYhQa9Lk

At the @WhiteHouse today where President Biden is discussing his Cancer Moonshot Initiative including a new federal focus on reducing deaths related to cancer.

WATCH LIVE: https://t.co/akmO10uVWl
Want to learn more about the legislative efforts & funding we are delivering for the WNY community? Follow Rep. Higgins on Instagram! https://t.co/fScs4tRj0v

Now underway:  

The @WaysMeansCmte discusses the urgent need to address the mental health crisis in America including better supporting the wellbeing of healthcare workers and youth.

Watch here... https://t.co/YEPzMndLPf

Reminder: You can order up to 4 free at home COVID-19 tests for your household delivered right to your mailbox!

Order online today at: https://t.co/ia88vZtnm3

During the COVID-19 pandemic, WNY has seen a surge in deadly shootings.

This #GVSurvivorsWeek we must reaffirm our support for survivors, listen to their stories, & recommit to finding solutions to end this unnecessary violence in our community & across the country. https://t.co/eYat2HxkBI
Way to go @SBWorkersUnited of WNY for leading the way! #unionstrong https://t.co/f4kHaHp88Z

The enhanced #ChildTaxCredit helped 228K WNY families, providing basic needs, greater financial stability, & lifting children out of poverty. Without it, families are struggling once again.

We must continue working to make the enhanced #CTC permanent.
https://t.co/yyV5AXpad2
New free testing sites in Buffalo and Cheektowaga https://t.co/Tt15RRThRh

During #BlackHistoryMonth learn more about WNY's role in freeing people from slavery. The Niagara Falls Underground Railroad Heritage Center depicts our local history as the final stop on the underground railroad. @NFUGRR #NationalFreedomDay

Learn more: https://t.co/5YvyhKJIRi

We joined @USACE_Buffalo to celebrate the completion of new seawall at Ralph C. Wilson Jr. Park.

The project restored critical infrastructure protecting waterfront access & the Col. Francis G. Ward pumping station, which provides water to 250K residents & businesses in Buffalo. https://t.co/xcUghNPON5

#OTD in 1940, Ida May Fuller became the 1st person to receive a check after the Social Security Act became law.

On the 82nd anniversary, we are working to pass Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust Act to make sure SS is available to retirees for decades to come. #Secure2100 https://t.co/gpXGg42rlQ
It's official. Today the @POTUS signed the Willie O'Ree Congressional Gold Medal Act into law. https://t.co/mWY1yzlVAt

The @IRS Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program offers free tax prep to qualified individuals.
VITA tax prep is available at  Northwest Buffalo Community Center by appointment M & W 4PM-7:30PM & Sat. 9AM-1:30PM. Call 211 to schedule.
VITA info: https://t.co/aG9Ll36T7L https://t.co/m1wc6YoBZ1

The Affordable Connectivity Program provides $30/month discounts on internet bills for low-income families, $75/month discounts on Tribal lands, & a one time discount on a digital device.

In 2022, thousands of WNY families qualify for the ACP. Learn more: https://t.co/zATg0pIxjo https://t.co/26f7UAjPGn

Art orgs will play an important role in healing the nation post-pandemic. $50k in #AmericanRescuePlan funding, provided through the @NEAarts will help support jobs, facilities, & outreach expenses as @squeakybuffalo recovers from the COVID-19 pandemic. 
https://t.co/iGdHZpLylH

This year 14.5M Americans signed up for #ACA healthcare, breaking the previous enrollment record by 2M.

The ACA decreases healthcare costs & covers preexisting conditions. A record number of families now have access to the quality care they need.

https://t.co/50Gn6MotiI

Administered by the @FCC, the ACP provides low-income families with a monthly discount on internet bills & a one time discount on a computer or tablet. This year, thousands of WNY families will qualify for the ACP. Is your household eligible? Learn more: https://t.co/3NroaSlUvZ https://t.co/6owRiW5oiC

Thanks to the #infrastructure law, the Affordable Connectivity Program is replacing the Emergency Broadband Benefit long-term, providing affordable broadband in WNY!

Today with local leaders we announced this historic investment that will help thousands of WNY families. https://t.co/1cJAimpjff

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law included $17B for ports, harbors & waterways. WNY investments include Scajaquada Creek and Times Beach.

Read more about the Times Beach project via @TheBuffaloNews
https://t.co/0V063vhUHO https://t.co/zYV62CCzfo

@HouseBudgetDems @HHSGov In WNY, cold winters lead to high heating bills. Additional HEAP funding provided by the #AmericanRescuePlan will help thousands of families recover from the pandemic.

Read more at: https://t.co/FNbFVDN3Ws https://t.co/JxkSbT9f0u

The Earned Income Tax Credit lifts taxpayers out of poverty. In 2021, 25M received an avg EITC refund of $2.4K, but many eligible didn't claim the credit.
On #EITCDay be sure you're taking advantage of #EITC & all the credits you qualify for. 

Learn more: https://t.co/khfAFpAnRh https://t.co/F72u1pe0aI

This has been a tough time for many because of COVID, yet we made major economic gains in 2021. & thanks to historic legislation, like the Bipartisan #Infrastructure Law & the #AmericanRescuePlan, WNY has gotten much needed relief and long-term funding. There is more work to do. https://t.co/QfoxUaDJKB

#HolocaustRemembranceDay marks the 77th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau.

We will #NeverForget the 6 million lives lost & the atrocities that took place. We must remain committed to standing up against antisemitism & hatred that still exists today. #NeverAgain https://t.co/sGmYliax83

Congress more than doubled HEAP funding, thanks in part to the #AmericanResucePlan, making $875M available to NYers.

This year it's assisting families in need with their current & past-due energy bills, helping the WNY economy recover from the pandemic. https://t.co/6FGnMHP3iy

On January 22, 1945 @USArmy PFC Edward Dzieciuch spent his 18th birthday in the bloodiest battle of WWII, the Battle of the Bulge.

He came home, worked at @GM for 41 yrs & raised his family. 

On his 96th b-day he received the medals earned decades ago.
https://t.co/pyfhkrfz3q https://t.co/n64F2PXE8J

Vaccines remain our best defense against contracting & spreading severe COVID-19 infections, especially for students. New #VaxForKids sites are coming to WNY. Checkout the full list of clinics & schedule an appointment for your children today.
https://t.co/xumXZHuiw5

Additional HEAP and Weatherization funding was recently approved by Congress. Learn more about the resources available to WNYers. https://t.co/BAPi8bBL5A
Safety. Security. Dignity. These are the things you get when you form or join a union. Kudos to the Starbucks partners who took a stand and defended their rights. https://t.co/INElN9uk7v
If you or someone you know is a victim of human trafficking, help is available. Contact the National Human Trafficking Hotline by calling 1-800-373-7888 or texting 233733.

1 yr ago today @POTUS reversed the ban on transgender individuals serving in the military, demonstrating we are a nation that not only fights for equality across the globe but recognizes the strength of diversity within our ranks. #TransRightsAreHumanRights https://t.co/miYUs4WGzv

Today, during National Human Trafficking Prevention Month, we announced 2 federal grants for Erie County & @IIBuff totaling $1.5M, which will support the Western District of New York Human Trafficking Task Force in supporting survivors of human trafficking. #endtrafficking https://t.co/PbpnOSUFKv

Congress‚Äôs commitment to social justice should never waver, especially as efforts to protect our democracy, safeguard voting rights, and prevent discrimination grow more urgent. Proud that our voting record aligned with @NETWORKLobby in 2021. https://t.co/mInIBLVpe4
Join us live on Facebook today at 1 pm to learn more about a partnership between @IIBuff, @ECSONY1, @WDNYnews, @ecbavlp, & other local organizations to combat human trafficking here in WNY.

Investing in our children's education is critical for the future of our community.
We must continue working to expand access to universal pre-k through public schools, Head Start programs, & other licensed childcare providers so all children have an equitable educational start.

Seniors & people with disabilities deserve quality care in their own home. The demand for home health care is growing, yet we're already experiencing shortages.
We will continue pushing for fair wages & training to address staff turnover & meet the needs of our aging population.

Since day one of COVID-19, our healthcare workers have been on the frontlines, risking their lives to save others.

Over $1M in federal funding awarded to @UBuffalo will support healthcare workers through training to better address burnout & mental health. https://t.co/kTCsjiGobf

Advance #ChildTaxCredit payments have been a lifeline for 77k families in NY26.

Parents use it for essentials like child care, rent, groceries.

Congress must continue this vital benefit in support of our children.
https://t.co/ok81wbbrbN

The bipartisan infrastructure law commits $1B to reconnecting communities divided by infrastructure failings.

@GovKathyHochul is leading the way here in NY, making investments that serve to unite & strengthen communities including here in Buffalo's Humboldt Parkway neighborhood. https://t.co/E02UMrArjm

The Kensington Expressway altered & disconnected neighborhoods on the East Side of Buffalo.

Today we joined @GovKathyHochul & local officials to announce the start of an environmental impact study necessary to turn the Kensington into the beautiful Humboldt Parkway WNY remembers https://t.co/O3rozdKZKX

Our community values historic preservation - it is powering our future by leveraging our past. The Great Northern Grain Elevator has long been neglected, but can be saved and put to a new use. Buffalo is worth it. https://t.co/IdeFCVfut1

Wishing WWII @USArmy veteran Edward Dzieciuch a very happy 96th birthday.

While serving as a Parachute Rifleman he participated in the liberation of Berchtesgaden, Germany, home to Hitler‚Äôs Berghof residence.

We recently presented the medals he earned over 75 yrs ago. https://t.co/qw5mlUbqFb

Two years ago this week the first COVID-19 case was confirmed in the US. Although we've made progress to protect ourselves, the pandemic is far from over.

.@ECDOH has vaccination clinics all weekend & throughout the rest of the month. Schedule today at: https://t.co/MSDGUAnjfg

The Bipartisan #Infrastructure Law is providing millions to improve transportation, connect communities, & rebuild water infrastructure.

In WNY this funding will create jobs, reconnect divided neighborhoods, improve waterfront accessibility, & upgrade our roads & bridges. https://t.co/N1K8xb7qEc

.@GM's $154M investment at their Lockport plant is our region's first in electric vehicle manufacturing. This is an exciting step in confronting climate change that creates jobs in WNY & works to improve our nation's supply chains.

An investment in clean infrastructure is an investment in the future of our country. However, we must pass the #BuildBackBetter agenda to accurately address WNY's climate crisis & create a more sustainable future.

$10 million coming to Times Beach on Buffalo‚Äôs Outer Harbor.

Veterans transitioning to civilian life have earned VA health benefits, but sometimes the step of enrolling can fall through the cracks

This bill makes enrollment automatic for those eligible, ensuring health care resources are available for our veterans 
https://t.co/dv1uOUB7kh https://t.co/eyeMYc6siS

.@USInterior's Federal Indian Boarding School Initiative examines gov't involvement in schools serving native youth.

The Thomas Indian School forced assimilation among @TheSenecaNation youth. In a letter we urged @SecDebHaaland to include the school in the dept's 2022 report. ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/1FEej11CXu
